author: Nerdstalgic
description:
Quentin Tarantino has given us some of cinema’s most chilling and terrifying villains. From Hans Landa in Inglourious Basterds to Calvin Candie in Django Unchained and beyond. But none embody the Psycho Killer archetype quite like Mr. Blonde in Reservoir Dogs.

When Reservoir Dogs first hit theaters in 1992, audiences were both disturbed and fascinated by Mr. Blonde’s casual approach to violence. His infamous "ear" scene remains one of the most shocking and unsettling moments in Tarantino’s filmography.

Do YOU think Mr. Blonde is Tarantino’s scariest villain? Or does Hans Landa or Calvin Candie take the crown? Let us know in the comments!

#reservoirdogs #quentintarantino #tarantino #pulpfiction
title: How Quentin Tarantino Created A Psychopath
